QUESTION 83) Brazil has a large number of distinct species between animals, plants and microorganisms surrounded in immense complexity and distributed in a wide variety of ecosystems.
SANDES, A. R. R.; BLASI, G. Biodiversity and chemical and genetic diversity. The increase in variability occurs due to genetic exchange, which provides the exchange of segments between non -sister chromatids in meiosis.
This exchange of segments is decisive in
A) Production of more fertile individuals.
B) transmission of new acquired characteristics.
C) Genetic recombination in the formation of gametes.
D) occurrence of somatic mutations in the descendants.
E) Variation in the number of chromosomes characteristic of the species.
